page.title: 10INDUSTRY - NORTH TAWTON
page.content: {THE WOOL FACTORY }was built 98 years ago.There were 200 people working there when it first opened.It was a fully integrated woollen mill,the wool was washed,combed,spun and woven all in the same factory - an unusual feature.{POWER}for the machines came from water turbines water supplied by the{RIVER TAW.}It stopped working as a woollen mill in 1930 when wool was henceforth only stored in the factory and was sent to Bradford for finishing. {THE CHEESE FACTORY}was officially opened on 26th April,1974,by the Rt.Hon.Norman Buchan,M.P.,Minister of State,Ministry of Agriculture Fisheries and Foods.Situated in Devon,largest milk producing County in England,the factory draws milk from 1000 producers in area bounded by S. Molton,Bampton,Launceston,Bovey Tracey
